perturbation.original_text: The Continued Service provided by Netzee will be the operation, maintenance, and support of the computer systems, software and interfaces included in the System.
perturbation.changed_text: The Ongoing Assistance provided by Netzee will be the operation, maintenance, and support of the computer systems, software and interfaces included in the System.
perturbation.explanation: The contract uses both 'Continued Service' and 'Ongoing Assistance' without defining if they are the same thing, causing confusion about the obligations of Netzee. This could lead to disputes over whether specific support activities fall under the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Bankers Bank agrees to pay fees equal to $40 per month for all Participating Banks (original or added) for which maintenance is provided.
perturbation.changed_text: Bankers Bank agrees to pay fees equal to $40 per month for all Member Banks (original or added) for which maintenance is provided.
perturbation.explanation: The contract uses both 'Participating Banks' and 'Member Banks' without defining if they are the same thing. If there is no clear understanding of whether the terms are interchangeable, it may result in an under or over billing of the amount that is agreed.

perturbation.original_text: Maintenance provided by Netzee during the term of this Agreement shall include (1) standard maintenance upgrades and modifications offered by Netzee to its customers generally, standard maintenance upgrades and modifications offered by Netzee to its customers generally, and for such purpose Netzee will use commercially reasonable efforts to make and include (without limitation) as such modifications changes and upgrades necessary to comply with generally applicable industry and regulatory requirements of which it is notified (2) 5x12 call-in support between hours of 6:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m. Eastern Time Monday through Friday, (3) in the event of material discrepancies between the Services as provided and the specifications for such Services (which shall be furnished in reasonably acceptable form), reasonable effort (in relation to importance, impact, and scheduled development plans) to correct those discrepancies, and (4) availability of basic Services with at least 99% uptime between 4:00 a.m Monday and 7:00 p.m. Friday and between 8:00 a.m. Saturday and 2:00 p.m. Saturday Eastern Time, exclusive of outages caused by off-peak prescheduled maintenance or causes beyond Netzee's reasonable control (including third-party equipment or communications).
perturbation.changed_text: Support provided by Netzee during the term of this Agreement shall include (1) standard maintenance upgrades and modifications offered by Netzee to its customers generally, standard maintenance upgrades and modifications offered by Netzee to its customers generally, and for such purpose Netzee will use commercially reasonable efforts to make and include (without limitation) as such modifications changes and upgrades necessary to comply with generally applicable industry and regulatory requirements of which it is notified (2) 5x12 call-in support between hours of 6:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m. Eastern Time Monday through Friday, (3) in the event of material discrepancies between the Services as provided and the specifications for such Services (which shall be furnished in reasonably acceptable form), reasonable effort (in relation to importance, impact, and scheduled development plans) to correct those discrepancies, and (4) availability of basic Services with at least 99% uptime between 4:00 a.m Monday and 7:00 p.m. Friday and between 8:00 a.m. Saturday and 2:00 p.m. Saturday Eastern Time, exclusive of outages caused by off-peak prescheduled system downtime or causes beyond Netzee's reasonable control (including third-party equipment or communications).
perturbation.explanation: This alteration introduces confusion by using both “Maintenance” and “Support,” terms of similar intent, without clarifying that those concepts are referring to the same thing. Additionally, “off-peak prescheduled maintenance” is changed to “off-peak prescheduled system downtime.” The failure to align terminology on those occasions can result in an incorrect interpretation of what constitutes compliance with the agreement.
